name: Ancient Burial Sites
timing: At the start of the agenda phase
effect: Choose 1 player. Exhaust each cultural planet owned by that player.

name: Assassinate Representative
effect: Choose 1 player. That player cannot vote on this agenda.

name: Bribery
timing: After the speaker votes on an agenda
effect: Spend any number of trade goods . For each trade good spent, cast 1 additional vote for the outcome on which you voted .

name: Bunker
timing: At the start of an invasion
effect: During this invasion, apply -4 to the result of each Bombardment roll against planets you control.

name: Confusing Legal Text
timing: When you are elected as the outcome of an agenda
effect: Choose 1 player. That player is the elected player instead.

name: Construction Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 space dock from your reinforcements on a planet you control.

name: Courageous to the End
timing: After 1 of your ships is destroyed during a space combat
effect: Roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, your opponent must choose and destroy 1 of their ships.

name: Cripple Defenses
effect: Choose 1 planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet.

name: Diplomacy Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains a planet you control. Each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in that system.

name: Direct Hit
timing: After another player's ship uses Sustain Damage to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
effect: Destroy that ship.

name: Disable
timing: At the start of an invasion in a system that contains 1 or more of your opponents' PDS units
effect: Your opponents' PDS units lose Planetary Shield and Space Cannon during this invasion.

name: Distinguished Councilor
timing: After you cast votes on an outcome of an agenda
effect: Cast 5 additional votes for that outcome.

name: Economic Initiative
effect: Ready each cultural planet you control.

name: Emergency Repairs
timing: At the start or end of a combat round
effect: Repair all of your units that have Sustain Damage in the active system.

name: Experimental Battlestation
timing: After another player moves ships into a system during a tactical action
effect: Choose 1 of your space docks that is either in or adjacent to that system. That space dock uses Space Cannon 5 (x3) against ships in the active system.

name: Fighter Prototype
timing: At the start of the first round of a space combat
effect: Apply +2 to the result of each of your fighters ' combat rolls during this combat round.

name: Fire Team
timing: After your ground forces make combat rolls during a round of ground combat
effect: Reroll any number of your dice.

name: Flank Speed
effect: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action .

name: Focused Research
effect: Spend 4 trade goods to research 1 technology .

name: Frontline Deployment
effect: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

name: Ghost Ship
effect: Place 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other players' ships.

name: Imperial Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda . Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 victory point.

name: In The Silence Of Space
effect: Choose 1 system. During this tactical action , your ships in the chosen system can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

name: Industrial Initiative
effect: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control.

name: Infiltrate
timing: When you gain control of a planet
effect: Replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements .

name: Insubordination
effect: Remove 1 token from another player's tactic pool and return it to their reinforcements .

name: Intercept
timing: After your opponent declares a retreat during a space combat
effect: Your opponent cannot retreat during this round of space combat.

name: Leadership Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 3 command tokens .

name: Lost Star Chart
effect: During this tactical action , systems that contain alpha and beta wormholes are adjacent to each other.

name: Lucky Shot
effect: Destroy 1 dreadnought , cruiser , or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control.

name: Maneuvering Jets
timing: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll
effect: Cancel 1 hit.

name: Mining Initiative
effect: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of 1 planet you control.

name: Morale Boost
timing: At the start of a combat round
effect: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

name: Parley
timing: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
effect: Return the committed units to the space area .

name: Plague
effect: Choose 1 planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.

name: Political Stability
timing: When you would return your strategy card (s) during the status phase
effect: Do not return your strategy card(s). You do not choose strategy cards during the next strategy phase.

name: Politics Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 3 action cards and gain the speaker token.

name: Public Disgrace
timing: When another player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase
effect: That player must choose a different strategy card instead, if able.

name: Reactor Meltdown
effect: Destroy 1 space dock in a non-home system.

name: Reparations
timing: After another player gains control of a planet you control
effect: Exhaust 1 planet that player controls and ready 1 planet you control.

name: Repeal Law
effect: Discard 1 law from play.

name: Rise of a Messiah
effect: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet you control.

name: Sabotage
timing: When another player plays an action card other than "Sabotage"
effect: Cancel that action card.

name: Salvage
timing: After you win a space combat
effect: Your opponent gives you all of their commodities .

name: Shields Holding
timing: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat
effect: Cancel up to 2 hits.

name: Signal Jamming
effect: Chose 1 non-home system that contains or is adjacent to 1 of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.

name: Skilled Retreat
timing: At the start of a combat round
effect: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; the space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.

name: Spy
effect: Choose 1 player. That player gives you 1 random action card from their hand.

name: Summit
timing: At the start of the strategy phase
effect: Gain 2 command tokens .

name: Tactical Bombardment
effect: Choose 1 system that contains 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment . Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system.

name: Technology Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, research 1 technology.

name: Trade Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 5 trade goods .

name: Unexpected Action
effect: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board and return it to your reinforcements .

name: Unstable Planet
effect: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.

name: Upgrade
timing: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your ships
effect: Replace one of your cruisers in that system with one of your dreadnoughts from your reinforcements .

name: Uprising
effect: Exhaust 1 non-home planet controlled by another player. Then gain trade goods equal to its resource value.

name: Veto
effect: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

name: War Effort
effect: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

name: Warfare Rider
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 dreadnought from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

name: Blitz
timing: At the start of an invasion
effect: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have BOMBARDMENT gain BOMBARDMENT 6 until the end of the invasion.

name: Counterstroke
timing: After a player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens
effect: Return that command token to your tactic pool .

name: Fighter Conscription
effect: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or units that have capacity ; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.

name: Forward Supply Base
timing: After another player activates a system that contains your units
effect: Gain 3 trade goods . Then, choose another player to gain 1 trade good.

name: Ghost Squad
timing: After a player commits units to land on a planet you control
effect: Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.

name: Hack Election
effect: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to the right of the speaker and continues counterclockwise.

name: Harness Energy
effect: Replenish your commodities .

name: Impersonation
effect: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective .

name: Insider Information
effect: Look at the top card of the agenda deck.

name: Master Plan
effect: You may perform an additional action this turn.

name: Plagiarize
effect: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by 1 of your neighbors; gain that technology.

name: Rally
timing: After you activate a system that contains another player's ships
effect: Place 2 command tokens from your reinforcements in your fleet pool .

name: Reflective Shielding
timing: When one of your ships uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE during combat
effect: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships in the active system.

name: Sanction
effect: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome returns 1 command token from their fleet supply to their reinforcements .

name: Scramble Frequency
timing: After another player makes a BOMBARDMENT , SPACE CANNON , or ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE roll
effect: That player rerolls all of their dice.

name: Solar Flare
effect: During this movement , other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships.

name: War Machine
timing: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
effect: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

name: Archaeological Expedition
effect: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control; gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.

name: Confounding Legal Text
timing: When another player is elected as the outcome of an agenda
effect: You are the elected player instead.

name: Coup d'Etat
timing: When another player would perform a strategic action
effect: End that player's turn; the strategic action is not resolved and the strategy card is not exhausted .

name: Deadly Plot
timing: During the agenda phase , when an outcome would be resolved
effect: If you voted for or predicted another outcome, discard the agenda instead; the agenda is resolved with no effect and it is not replaced. Then, exhaust all of your planets.

name: Decoy Operation
timing: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your structures
effect: Remove up to 2 of your ground forces from the game board and place them on a planet you control in the active system.

name: Diplomatic Pressure
effect: Choose another player; that player must give you 1 promissory note from their hand.

name: Divert Funding
effect: Return a non- unit upgrade , non- faction technology that you own to your technology deck. Then, research another technology.

name: Exploration Probe
effect: Explore a frontier token that is in or adjacent to a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

name: Manipulate Investments
timing: At the start of the Strategy Phase
effect: Place a total of 5 trade goods from the supply on strategy cards of your choice; you must place these tokens on at least 3 different cards.

name: Nav Suite
effect: During the " Movement " step of this tactical action , ignore the effects of anomalies .

name: Refit Troops
effect: Choose 1 or 2 of your infantry on the game board; replace each of those infantry with mechs .

name: Reveal Prototype
timing: At the start of a combat
effect: Spend 4 resources to research a unit upgrade technology of the same type as 1 of your units that is participating in this combat.

name: Reverse Engineer
timing: When another player discards an action card that has a component action
effect: Take that action card from the discard pile.

name: Rout
timing: At the start of the "Announce Retreats" step of space combat , if you are the defender
effect: Your opponent must announce a retreat, if able.

name: Scuttle
effect: Choose 1 or 2 of your non-fighter ships on the game board and return them to your reinforcements ; gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those ships.

name: Seize Artifact
effect: Choose 1 of your neighbors that has 1 or more relic fragments . That player must give you 1 relic fragment of your choice.

name: Waylay
timing: Before you roll dice for ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE
effect: Hits from this roll are produced against all ships (not just fighters).

name: Black Market Dealings
timing: When you are negotiating a transaction
effect: You and the other player can include relics, action cards, and unscored secret objectives as part of the transaction. This card cannot be cancelled.

name: Brillance
effect: Ready 1 of your planets that has a technology speciality or choose 1 player to gain their breakthrough.

name: Crash Landing
timing: When your last ship in the active system is destroyed
effect: Place 1 of your ground forces from the space area of the active system onto a planet in that system other than Mecatol Rex; if the planet contains other players' units, place your ground force into coexistence.

name: Crisis
timing: At the end of any player's turn, if there are at least 2 players who have not passed
effect: Skip the next player's turn.

name: Exchange Program
effect: Choose another player. You and the player may agree to place 1 infantry from each of your reinforcements into coexistence on a planet the other player controls that contains their ground forces; if no agreement is reached, you each discard 1 token from your fleet pool.

name: Extreme Duress
timing: At the start of another player's turn, if they have a readied strategy card
effect: If that player's next action is not a strategic action, they discard all of their action cards, gives you all of their trade goods, and shows you all of their secret objectives.

name: Lie in Wait
timing: After 2 of your neighbours resolve a transaction
effect: Look at each of those player's hands of action cards, then choose and take 1 action card from each.

name: Mercenary Contract
effect: Spend 2 trade goods to place 2 neutral infantry on any non-home planet that contains no units; if that planet was owned by another player, they return its planet card to the planet card deck.

name: Pirate Contract
effect: Place 1 neutral destroyer in a non-home system that contains no non-neutral ships.

name: Pirate Fleet
effect: Spend 3 resources to place 1 neutral carrier, 1 neutral cruiser, 1 neutral destroyer, and 2 neutral fighters in a non-home system that contains no non-neutral ships.

name: Puppets on a String
timing: At the end of any player's turn, if you have passed
effect: Perform 1 action.

name: Rescue
timing: After another player moves ships into a system that contains your ships
effect: You may move 1 of your ships into the active system from any system that does not contain one of your command tokens.

name: Strategize
effect: Perform the secondary ability of any readied or unchosen strategy card

name: Overrule
effect: Perform the primary ability of any readied or unchosen strategy card

name: Master Plan Ω
effect: Perform an additional action.

name: Fighter Conscription Ω
effect: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or ships that have a capacity value; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.

name: Blitz Ω
timing: At the start of an invasion
effect: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that does not have BOMBARDMENT gains BOMBARDMENT 6 until the end of the invasion.

name: Hack Election Ω
effect: During this agenda, you vote last.

name: Solar Flare Ω
effect: During the "Movement " step of this tactical action, other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships.

name: Counterstroke Ω
timing: After another player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens
effect: Return that command token to your tactic pool .

name: Ghost Squad Ω
timing: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
effect: Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.

name: War Machine Ω
timing: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
effect: Apply +4 to the total PRODUCTION value of those units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

name: Command
effect: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action. Additionally, your ships may move through and into asteroid fields during this movement

name: Hardlight
timing: Before hits are assigned to your units
effect: Cancel up to 2 hits.

name: Mutate
effect: Discard 1 of your abilities, then draw 1 ability.

name: Shatter
timing: When another player exhausts a genome or players an action card other than "Shatter"
effect: That genome is exhausted without effect, or that action card is canceled.

name: Spark
timing: After another player's unit uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities
effect: Destroy that unit.

name: Transpose
effect: Give 1 of your abilities to one of your neighbors, then take 1 of their abilities.

name: Vault
effect: You may ignore the effects of anomalies during this movement.

name: Create
effect: Gain 1 relic.

name: Stasis
timing: At the start of another player's turn
effect: Immediately end that player's turn.

name: Evolve
effect: Draw 1 card from any splice deck.'

name: Unravel
effect: Choose and purge a relic. If the relic belonged to another player, that player gains 1 victory point; if it belonged to you, put The Fracture into play and place 1 additional ingress token in a system that contains your units.

name: Manifest
effect: Resolve the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your units; reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 3.

name: Flux
effect: Either remove any player's command token from the board, or place a command token from any player's reinforcements in a system that contains or is adjacent to one of your ships.

name: Meteor
timing: When you would remove ground forces due to insufficient capacity
effect: Commit those ground forces to a planet in that system instead; resolve invasion on that planet using only those ground forces.

name: Engineer
timing: When you draw cards for a splice that you initiated
effect: Add 2 additional cards to the splice; after you choose your card, choose and discard 2 of the spliced cards before passing them to the next player.

name: Ignis
effect: Place a command token from your tactic pool in any non-home system; choose and destroy 1 unit in that system.

name: Genophage
effect: Discard 1 of your neighbors' genomes.

name: Reverse
effect: Reverse the order the spliced cards are passed.

name: Thieve
timing: When a splice ends, if you did not participate
effect: Take all of the remaining spliced cards.

name: Meld
timing: When a die is rolled by any player
effect: Roll two dice instead, and add the results together (max 10).

name: Cloak
effect: Your ships can move through systems that contain other players' ships during this action, and SPACE CANNON cannot be used against them.

name: Tartarus
timing: At the start of the strategy phase
effect: Choose a strategy card; that card cannot be picked unless there is no other option.

name: Trine
timing: During the "Space Cannon Offense" step of a tactical action
effect: Your units up to 2 systems away can use their SPACE CANNON abilities against ships in the active system.

name: Helic
effect: Initiate a splice of any type, including all players.

name: Atomize
effect: Purge your flagship and destroy all other units in its system.

name: Entangle
effect: All systems that contain alpha wormholes, beta wormholes, gamma wormholes, and gravity rifts are adjacent during this movement.

name: Elevate
effect: Draw 1 paradigm.

name: Feint
effect: Your units immediately retreat to an eligible system; do not place a command token in that system.

name: Coerce
effect: Choose a player; that player must give you 1 of their abilities.

name: Reflect
effect: For each trade good you have, either gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

name: Converge
timing: Before you roll dice for SPACE CANNON
effect: Your hits must be applied to non-fighter ships during SPACE CANNON OFFENSE, or mechs during SPACE CANNON DEFENSE, if able.

name: Divinity
timing: When 1 of your units would be destroyed
effect: It is not destroyed instead

name: Rise
effect: Either place 1 infantry on each planet you control or place 1 fighter in each system that contains your ships or space docks and no other players' ships.

name: Lash
timing: When one of your units is destroyed
effect: Destroy a unit in its system that has an equal or lower cost.

name: Manipulate
timing: After cards are drawn for a splice your are not participating in
effect: Take the cards and choose which card each participating player will take.

name: Timestop
timing: When a player activates a system that contains your units
effect: Immediately perform an action, during which you are the active player.

name: Scarab
effect: Choose a spliced card you own; gain 2 trade goods for each card you own with a faction origin that matches that card.

name: Meddle
effect: Add or subtract 1 from its result.

name: Pax
timing: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control
effect: Return the committed units to the space area; choose 1 of them to destroy.

name: Irradiate
effect: Choose 1 unit type other than flagship; reveal cards from the unit upgrade deck until you reveal a card of that type, if able. Then, gain that card and shuffle the rest back into the unit upgrade deck.

name: Twinning
timing: After another player resolves the component action of an action card
effect: Immediately resolve that action card as if you played it.

name: Starflare
effect: Choose a supernova; each player destroys 3 of their units in that supernova and each adjacent system.

name: Magnificence
effect: Move all units from the space area of any system into an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships.

name: Locust
effect: Choose 1 infantry in a system adjacent to your units and roll 1 die. On a result of 3 or higher, destroy that infantry and choose an infantry in the same or an adjacent system to repeat the roll; for each new roll, choose an infantry owned by a different player than the previous infantry, if able.
